page.title: 13FARMING NOW AND THEN
page.content: Mr. and Mrs. Watts have lived at {Knowle Farm}for forty years. They gave us some information about the farm and what life was like forty years ago and{how farming has changed since then. In{1939}they changed from horse and cart to tractors. There were no freisian cows then only lots of dairy Shorthorns. They didn't have silage because all the grass was made into hay. They did milking by hand because they had{no electricity}for milking. The hay was brought in loose and made into haystacks as there were no bailers. They had a hay knife and when they wanted some hay they cut it out of the hay stack which was a horrible job. There were no combine harvesters only binders and they needed three horses to pull them.
